channel.title: 3 Pilgrim Research — Companion Papers
channel.description: Plain‑language companion explainers for the 3 Pilgrim research library. Each entry links to the companion page (canonical) and the PDF/DOI of the full paper.

item.title: Negative Tomography: Structural Inference via Failure‑First Primitives
item.description: Defines a domain‑agnostic, failure‑first inference framework using negative primitives; shows symmetry as the fixed point under exhaustive negative satisfaction; provides design invariants. CC BY 4.0.

item.title: Friction‑Guided Optimization: Negative Tomography in Overparameterized Learning
item.description: Instantiates Negative Tomography for ML: gradient erosion carves negative space; Fisher information defines a parametric friction field; overparameterization amplifies degeneracy. Presents a 3‑phase FGO schedule with diagnostics. CC BY 4.0.

item.title: A Quantitative Model for Pricing Gold — Companion
item.description:
A simple model for estimating the intrinsic value of gold. Long‑run gold supply tightly tracks global GDP and labor output, enabling rational pricing based on utility, productivity, and persistent demand trends.

PDF: https://3pilgrim.com/papers-pdfs/A-Quantitative-Model-for-Pricing-Gold-v1.0.pdf
DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18235084

item.title: The Half‑Life of Fiat — Companion
item.description:
Fiat systems have a generational half‑life. Monetary drift follows a predictable temporal decay curve; stability erodes on a decades‑scale clock.

PDF: https://3pilgrim.com/papers-pdfs/The-Half-Life-of-Fiat-A-Statistical-History-of-Monetary-Decay-v1.0.pdf
DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18055894

item.title: The Temporal Lattice of Fiat Stability — Companion
item.description:
Time, not levels, stabilizes fiat. WAM and the compression rate κ act as first‑order signals; TSR diagnoses when stability flips from damped to reflexive.

PDF: https://3pilgrim.com/papers-pdfs/Duration-Compression-as-a-Structural-Risk-Signal-v1.0.pdf
DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18355899

item.title: Primitive Asymmetries of Persistence — Companion
item.description:

item.title: The Compute Efficiency Frontier — Companion
item.description:
Why hyperscale LLMs cannot scale beyond physics. Six walls—compute, power, heat, data, parallelism, transmission—define an efficiency frontier that caps infrastructure scale.

PDF: https://3pilgrim.com/papers-pdfs/The-Compute-Efficiency-Frontier-Why-Bigger-Models-Hit-Physical-Boundaries-v1.0.pdf

item.title: Semiotic Frustration in Machine Learning — Companion
item.description:
